description.value: A scale for assessing outcome after head injury and non-traumatic acute brain insults.

purpose.value: To record the result for each component parameter and the total score for Glasgow Outcome Scale - Extended.

short.value: Glasgow Outcome Scale - Extended (GOSE)

definition.value: A scale for assessing outcome after head injury and non-traumatic acute brain insults.

short.value: Item tree
Any event

definition.value: Default, unspecified point in time or interval event which may be explicitly defined in a template or at run-time.

short.value: Date of injury
Date of injury
Age at injury
Age at injury
Interval post-injury
Interval post-injury
1. Is the head injured person able to obey simple commands, or say any words?
1. Is the head injured person able to obey simple commands, or say any words?
Independence in the home
2a Is the assistance of another person at home essential every day for some activities of daily living?
2a Is the assistance of another person at home essential every day for some activities of daily living?
2b Do they need frequent help or someone to be around at home most of the time?
2b Do they need frequent help or someone to be around at home most of the time?
2c Was the assistance at home essential before the injury?
2c Was the assistance at home essential before the injury?
Independence outside the home
3a Are they able to shop without assistance?
3a Are they able to shop without assistance?
3b Were they able to shop without assistance before the injury?
3b Were they able to shop without assistance before the injury?
4a Are they able to travel locally without assistance?
4a Are they able to travel locally without assistance?
4b Were they able to travel without assistance before the injury?
4b Were they able to travel without assistance before the injury?
5a Are they currently able to work to their previous capacity?
5a Are they currently able to work to their previous capacity?
5b How restricted are they?
5b How restricted are they?
5c Were they either working or seeking employment before the injury (answer 'yes') or were they doing neither (answer 'no')?
5c Were they either working or seeking employment before the injury (answer 'yes') or were they doing neither (answer 'no')?
Social & leisure activities
6a Are they able to resume regular social and leisure activities outside home?
6a Are they able to resume regular social and leisure activities outside home?
6b What is the extent of restricition on their social and leisure activities?
6b What is the extent of restricition on their social and leisure activities?
6c Did they engage in regular social and leisure activities outside home before the injury?
6c Did they engage in regular social and leisure activities outside home before the injury?
Family & friendships
7a Have there been psychological problems which have resulted in ongoing family disruption or disruption to friendships?
7a Have there been psychological problems which have resulted in ongoing family disruption or disruption to friendships?
7b What has been the extent of disruption or strain?
7b What has been the extent of disruption or strain?
7c Were there problems with family or friends before the injury?
7c Were there problems with family or friends before the injury?
Return to normal life
8a Are there any other current problems relating to the injury which affect daily life?
8a Are there any other current problems relating to the injury which affect daily life?
8b Were similar problems present before the injury?
8b Were similar problems present before the injury?
Since the injury has the head injured person had any epileptic fits?
Since the injury has the head injured person had any epileptic fits?
Have they been told that they are currently at risk of developing epilepsy?
Have they been told that they are currently at risk of developing epilepsy?
What is the most important factor in outcome?
What is the most important factor in outcome?

definition.value: The overall rating based on the lowest outcome value indicated on the scale.
The overall rating based on the lowest outcome value indicated on the scale.
